intro: Sarcoglottis assurgens, commonly known as the climbing sarcoglottis, is a tropical vine native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Aristolochiaceae, which includes plants known for their complex, often aromatic flowers. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and produces showy, hooded flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. Its climbing habit allows it to ascend trees and other structures in its natural habitat. Sarcoglottis assurgens is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical rainforests.
